item.title: Fixed map command for hybrid
item.dc:creator: @ZhaR ZhaR
item.description:
@ZhaR wrote:

Fasga, you made it? Tell me the difference between the walk types[br][size=1]Posted at: April 06, 2006, 08:20:55 pm[/size][hr]Can i do something like this:

public void map(String s)
{

    File f = new File("./autospawn.cfg");

    try{
        BufferedReader buff = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(f));
        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(f, true));
        String line = buff.readLine();
        while(line != null){
            line = buff.readLine();

        }
        if(line == null){
            pw.println("spawn = " + s + "   " + absX + "   " + absY + "   "+heightLevel+"   " + absX + " +3

" + absY + " +3 " + absX + " -3 " + absY +" -3 1 None");
pw.flush();
}
buff.close();
pw.close();
}
catch(Exception e){}
}--------------------------------------???

This compiles, but doesnt work[br][size=1]Posted at: April 06, 2006, 08:27:41 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind I got it fixed. I will release the edited version.

item.title: Fixed map command for hybrid
item.dc:creator: @masonw masonw
item.description:
@masonw wrote:

Replace your public void map with this:

[code] public void map(String s)
{

    File f = new File("./autospawn.cfg");

    try{
        BufferedReader buff = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(f));
        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(f, true));
        String line = buff.readLine();
        while(line != null){
            line = buff.readLine();

        }
        if(line == null){
            pw.println("spawn = " + s + "	" + absX + "	" + absY + "	"+heightLevel+"	1	1	1	1	1	Spawned using map command");
            pw.flush();
        }
        buff.close();
        pw.close();
    }
    catch(Exception e){}
}[/code]

Read full topic
